sections.title: Real Numbers
learningObjectives: Classify whole numbers as odd, even, prime and composite in different situations
Classify real numbers as rational and irrational in different situations
Determine the reciprocal of real numbers by division
Determine the reciprocal of real numbers by use of mathematical tables and calculators
Apply reciprocal of real numbers in mathematical computations
Promote the use of real numbers in day-to-day activities

sections.title: Indices and Logarithms
learningObjectives: Express numbers in index form
Derive the laws of indices using factors
Apply the laws of indices in different situations
Relate index notation to logarithm notation to base 10
Determine common logarithms of numbers from mathematical tables and calculators
Apply common logarithms in multiplication, division, powers and roots of numbers
Appreciate the use of indices and common logarithms in mathematical computations

topics.title: Finding Logarithms Using Tables and Calculators
Using logarithms to compute Products and Ratios

sections.title: Quadratic Expressions and Equations
learningObjectives: Form quadratic expressions from different situations
Derive the quadratic identities from the concept of area
Apply quadratic identities in numerical cases
Factorise quadratic expressions from different situations
Form quadratic equations in different situations
Solve quadratic equations by factorisation
Apply quadratic equations to real life situations
Explore the use of quadratic equations in real life situations

sections.title: Similarity and Enlargement
learningObjectives: Determine the centre of enlargement and the linear scale factor for similar figures
Apply similarity and enlargement to real-life situations
Appreciate the use of similarity and enlargement in real-life situations
Construct the image of an object under an enlargement given the centre and the linear scale factor
Determine the area and volume scale factor of different figures and solids
Relate linear scale factor, area scale factor, and volume scale factor in enlargements

sections.title: Reflection and Congruence
learningObjectives: Identify lines of symmetry in plane figures
Determine the properties of reflection in different situations
Draw an image given an object and a mirror line on plane surface and Cartesian plane
Determine the equation of the mirror line given an object and its image
Carry out congruence tests for triangles
Promote use of reflection and congruence in real-life situations

sections.title: Rotation
learningObjectives: Determine the properties of rotation in different situations
Appreciate the application of rotation in real-life situations
Rotate an object given the centre and angle of rotation on a plane surface and the Cartesian plane
Determine the centre and angle of rotation given an object and its image
Determine the order of rotational symmetry of plane figures
Determine the axis and order of rotational symmetry in solids
Deduce congruence from rotation

sections.title: Trigonometry 1
learningObjectives: Relate the sine, cosine and tangent of acute angles
Relate sines and cosines of complementary angles
Determine trigonometric ratios of special angles: 30, 45, 60, and 90 degrees using triangles
Determine the trigonometric ratios of acute angles from mathematical tables and calculators
Apply trigonometric ratios to angles of elevation and depression
Reflect on the use of trigonometry in real-life situations

subsections.title: Sines and Cosines of Acute Angles
Sines and Cosines of Complementary Angles

sections.title: Area of Polygons
learningObjectives: Derive the formula for the area of a triangle given two sides and an included angle
Work out the area of a triangle given two sides and an included angle
Determine the area of a triangle using Heron's formula
Determine the area of quadrilaterals in different situations
Explore the area of polygons as used in real-life situations
Work out the area of regular heptagon and octagon
Determine the area of irregular polygons in different situations

topics.title: Using Two Sides and an Angle

sections.title: Area of a Part of a Circle
learningObjectives: Determine the area of an annulus in different situations
Apply the area of a part of a circle in real-life situations
Explore the use of the area of a part of a circle in real-life situations
Work out the area of a sector of a circle in real-life situations
Determine the area of an annular sector in different situations
Work out the area of a segment of a circle
Determine the area of common region between two intersecting circles

subsections.title: Area of Common Regions Between Circles
Area of a Part of a Circle in Real-Life

sections.title: Surface Area
learningObjectives: Determine the surface area of prisms, pyramids, cones, frustums and spheres
Explore the use of the surface area and volume of solids in real-life situations
Calculate the surface area of composite solids

subsections.title: Surface Area of Cubes and Cuboids

sections.title: Volume
learningObjectives: Calculate the volume of prisms, pyramids, cones, frustums and spheres
Explore the use of the surface area and volume of solids in real-life situations
Determine the volume of composite solids

sections.title: Vectors 1
learningObjectives: Explain vector and scalar quantities with illustrations
Use vector notations in different ways
Represent vectors geometrically in different situations
Determine column vectors in different situations
Determine position vectors in different situations
Work out magnitude of a vector in different situations
Determine the midpoint of a vector in different situations
Add vectors in different situations
Multiply vectors by scalars
Determine translation vector as a transformation
Identify equivalent vectors in different situations
Appreciate the use of vectors in real-life situations

sections.title: Linear Motion
learningObjectives: Explain the terms distance, displacement, speed, velocity and acceleration in real-life situations
Determine velocity and acceleration in different situations
Determine relative speed of two moving bodies in different situations
Draw a displacement-time graph of different situations
Interpret displacement-time graph in different situations
Draw a velocity-time graph from given tables in different situations
Interpret velocity-time graph in different situations
Appreciate use of linear motion in real-life situations

topics.title: Relative Speeds of Objects Moving in the Same Direction
Relative Speeds of Objects Moving in Different Directions

sections.title: Statistics 1
learningObjectives: Collect data from real-life sources
Promote data collection, organisation and representation for informed decision making
Draw a frequency distribution table for grouped and ungrouped data
Determine mean, mode and median of grouped and ungrouped data
Represent data using histograms and frequency polygons
Interpret data from histograms and frequency polygons

sections.title: Probability 1
learningObjectives: Perform experiments involving probabilities in different situations
Identify the range of probability in different situations
Appreciate the application of probability in real-life situations
Generate probability space of different events
Determine the probability of mutually exclusive and independent events
Determine the probability of independent events using tree diagrams
Apply the laws of probability in different situations
